11. Withdrawal, as manifested by either of the following:
a. The characteristic withdrawal syndrome for tobacco (refer
to Criteria A and B of the criteria set for tobacco withdrawal).
b. Tobacco (or a closely related substance, such as nico-
tine) is taken to relieve or avoid withdrawal symptoms.

In early remission: After full criteria for tobacco use disorder
were previously met, none of the criteria for tobacco use disorder
